Level: 1

Congratulation, you passed the level!

		Did you know, there is no number zero in the Rome numeral system?

		However number zero is specific like number 7.

		For example, programmers start to count objects from zero.
Next level
Level: 2
Pick the Rome numeric which is more.The questions can repeat until you take 10 points.

\t\tCongratulation, you passed the level!\n\n\t\tDid you know, Rome numbers, such as, I,II,III consist of the repeating ones. However, the repeating one symbol for four times is forbidden! For creation new numbers, Romans used adding or subtracting operations, for example, IV means 4, and VI means 6.
Ru
Level: 3

\t\tYou are given 4 images with various animal. Your task is to pick an animal which has the longest tail.\n\t\tThe questions will appear until you take 10 points.\n\t\tYou have only 5 seconds for each round to pick the right card.

\t\tCongratulation, you passed the level! Did you know, astrapia is derived from the Greek, meaning lightning or a flash.\n\t\tThe environment of the astrapia bird is New Guinea. The length of the tail is usually more than 1 meter!And it is considered as the animal with the longest tail.
True
False
Level: 4

Welcome to level 4!
		Your are given a statement, and you need to answer is it true or false?
		The questions will repeat until you take 10 points.
		You have only 5 seconds for each question.
		Good Luck!

\t\tOh,that was hard task, right? I see you are accomplished it. Great!\n\t\tHere are some new facts. Did you know, there’s enough gold inside Earth to coat the planet? Turns out, there’s quite a bit of gold on—or, really, in—our planet: 99 percent of the precious metal can be found in the Earth’s core, Discover Magazine reports. How much is there? Enough to coat the entire surface of the Earth in 1.5 feet of gold.\n\t\tOne more fact is Human beings can use only a small fraction of Earth’s water.\t In school, we were taught that most (specifically, 71 percent) of the planet’s surface is covered in water. While that’s true, humans can use only 0.007 percent of that water, according to National Geographic. That’s because only about 2.5 percent of Earth’s water is fresh water, and only 1 percent of that is accessible. The rest makes up glaciers and snowfields.
Level: 5

Welcome to level 5!
		Your task is to put some puzzle's fragments together. You are given a two fragments below, and you need to pick the piece related to the one of the loveliest season of the year is fall.
		If you make at least one of a mistake, the level will restart. The level is restricted by timer.
		Good Luck!

The image that you solved was made in Canada.
		In Canada, autumn is known as the "leaf-peeping" season.
		It’s one of the best places on the planet to see the leaves turn to fiery reds, oranges, and yellows.Wherever you go, the forest canopies will be aflame with brilliant colours and the trees flanking the roadsides will be putting on a gorgeous display.
		Did you know, March,April,May is autumn months in the South Pole?
Level: 6

Welcome to level 6!
		You are given 4 images with various weight. Your task is to pick the heaviest object.
		The questions will appear until you take 10 points.
		Good Luck!

\t\tDid you know, that a typical stellar-class of black hole has a mass between about 3 and 10 solar masses.\n\t\tSupermassive black holes exist in the center of most galaxies, including our own Milky Way Galaxy.

\t\tTomato sauce, Mozzarella, greens are always presented in the real Italian pizza. These components not only give special taste to the dishes, but also have symbolic sign, the color scheme represents Italian flag.

\t\tDid you know, that yellow and red together make you hungry? Fast food chains figured this out years ago and use this color combination over and over in branding, advertising and restaurant decor.

Main Menu

Congratulation! You've passed season 1!
		For now, you know a little bit more, than you launched the game the first time.
		The tip of the iceberg represent the superficial pieces of knowledge, and the underneath part are the deepest bits of knowledge. As in real life, the fact is, that tip of the iceberg can be seen, and the rest of the iceberg, which is much larger, is underneath the water and cannot be seen. 
		I hope your fragments of knowledge have become deeper than it was before. In order to achieve personal goals, you have to expand not only outlooks, but also your professional skills.
		Thank you for your time. I hope you will estimate the game highly.
